title: 112_hr461
content:
The Act is titled the "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for clarity. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines key terms such as District, Electric Distribution System, and Fixtures related to the power distribution system in the South Utah Valley Electric Service District. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines key terms related to the power distribution system, including irrigation or power facilities lands and distribution fixture lands within the Strawberry Valley Project. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines key terms related to the power distribution system, including shared power poles rated at 46.0 kilovolts owned by the United States and supporting fixtures of the Electric Distribution System. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms related to the power distribution system, including shared power poles rated at 46.0 kilovolts owned by the United States. The Strawberry Water Users Association conveyed its interest in the Electric Distribution System to the District, and the Secretary will transfer all rights and fixtures to the District without charge. This includes shared power poles for perpetual use. The District will receive perpetual licenses for shared power poles and access to lands necessary for operation, maintenance, and replacement of Electric Distribution Fixtures. Ownership of underlying lands will remain with the United States. Before conveying lands, interests in lands, and fixtures, the Secretary must comply with environmental laws such as the National Environmental Policy Act and the Endangered Species Act. This Act does not modify any existing laws. The Act does not modify obligations under the National Environmental Policy Act or the Endangered Species Act. It excludes power generation and 46kV transmission facilities from granting any interests to the District or other parties. Ownership of these facilities remains with the United States. SEC. 4. EFFECT OF CONVEYANCE.

Upon conveyance under section 3(a)(1):
- Conveyed land and facilities no longer part of Federal reclamation project
- District not entitled to future Bureau or Reclamation benefits
- United States not liable for damages related to the land and facilities

SEC. 5. REPORT. SEC. 5. REPORT.

If conveyance under section 3 is not completed within 1 year, the Secretary must submit a report to Congress within 30 days detailing the conveyance status, obstacles, and anticipated completion date.
